bill_title: to revise the composition of the Board of Regents to include one faculty member.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the composition of the Board of Regents to include one faculty member. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-49-2 be amended to read as follows: 13-49-2. The regents who are regular members shall be persons of probity and wisdom and selected from among the best known citizens, residents of different portions of the state, no two of whom may be residents in the same county and not more than six shall may be members of the same political party. One regent shall be the student regent as provided in § 13-49-6.1 , and one regent shall be the faculty regent as provided in section 3 of this Act . A regent's residence is determined by where the regent is registered to vote. Section 2. That § 13-49-3 be amended to read as follows: 13-49-3. Each regent, except the student regent and the faculty regent , shall be appointed for a term of six years and said the term shall expire on the last day of March or when a successor is appointed and qualified, unless removed as provided in § 3-17-1. Section 3. That chapter 13-49 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Governor shall appoint a faculty regent, by and with the consent of the senate, who shall participate in all board meetings open and closed and be compensated in the same manner as board members. The faculty regent shall be a faculty member of one of the public postsecondary educational institutions under the control of the board. The faculty regent shall be appointed for a term of two years which term shall expire on the first day of July of every even-numbered year, unless the faculty member is removed under the provisions of § 3-17-1 or the faculty member does not remain employed by a postsecondary institution controlled by the board. The faculty regent shall be a formal member of the board and shall vote. Section 4. That chapter 13-49 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Governor shall appoint a faculty regent upon the occurrence of the first vacancy on the Board of Regents after July 1, 1998, with the term to be governed by section 3 of this Act. A nonvoting faculty member may be appointed by the Governor until a vacancy occurs on the Board of Regents and a voting faculty member is appointed pursuant to section 3 of this Act. Section 5. That chapter 13-49 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The student regent and the faculty regent may not be from the same postsecondary institution.
